III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following area:

by the borrowed home annually.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during
this licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
The agency had one CAP during this review period. The CAP, approved 9/1/22,
was the result of the 8/11/22 interim evaluation. In the 2022 review the agency had
two citations regarding borrowed beds and treatment plan signatures. During the
current review, no violations were found. The agency reported successful
implementation of the CAP over the past year, as staff discussed the CAP often
and focused on those areas.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The chief administrator assessment (CAA) was reviewed and discussed on-site.
The CAA reported successful implementation of the 2022 CAP, as shown in the

findings of this review. There were no staff changes during this review period,
which contributed to stability within the agency. The chief administrator indicated
the agency continues to work on improving recruitment of foster parents, as this
has been an ongoing need.
Financial Overview
No financial concerns were noted.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Two staff were interviewed on-site. Both staff have been with the agency for about
five years. Both staff indicated they enjoy their jobs and feel the agency does a
great job with communication and support for staff. Neither staff identified any
concerns or areas needing improvement.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency remains in the same building as the previous two years. The office is
located off of a busy road in the city of Brighton. The office has sufficient locked
storage and office space. There is adequate room for families to have visits and
meet with caseworkers. No concerns were found.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular license.
